channel.title: CVE Feed for Hitachi Energy -- RTU500 series CMU firmware
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Hitachi Energy -- RTU500 series CMU firmware

item.title: CVE-2023-6711|2024-09-25T08:43:52.208Z -- hitachi%20energy -- rtu500%20series%20cmu%20firmware
item.description: Vulnerability exists in SCI IEC 60870-5-104 and HCI IEC 60870-5-104 that affects the RTU500 series product versions listed below. Specially crafted messages sent to the mentioned components are not validated properly and can result in buffer overflow and as final consequence to a reboot of an RTU500 CMU.

item.title: CVE-2022-28613|2024-09-25T07:58:13.187Z -- hitachi%20energy -- rtu500%20series%20cmu%20firmware
item.description: A vulnerability exists in the HCI Modbus TCP function included in the product versions listed above. If the HCI Modbus TCP is en-abled and configured, an attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted message to the RTU500, causing the receiving RTU500 CMU to reboot. The vulnerability is caused by the validation error in the length information carried in MBAP header in the HCI Modbus TCP function.

item.title: CVE-2024-2617|2024-06-04T17:29:04.729Z -- hitachi%20energy -- rtu500%20series%20cmu%20firmware
item.description: A vulnerability exists in the RTU500 that allows for authenticated and authorized users to bypass secure update. If a malicious actor successfully exploits this vulnerability, they could use it to update the RTU500 with unsigned firmware.

item.title: CVE-2024-2617|2024-08-01T19:18:48.011Z -- hitachi%20energy -- rtu500%20series%20cmu%20firmware
item.description: A vulnerability exists in the RTU500 that allows for authenticated and authorized users to bypass secure update. If a malicious actor successfully exploits this vulnerability, they could use it to update the RTU500 with unsigned firmware.
